subject: Re: [unclassified] RE: [junit] Proposed parameterized test syntax for JUnit 4
msgSnippet: ... I quite like this, Kent. It makes me happy to move my data-driven tests back from Fit RowFixtures into JUnit. Take care. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar
messageBody:
Kent Beck wrote:

> Here is a revised parameterized test proposal for comment. Three things
> have changed.
> * The class is now annotated with a class used to run it:
> @Factory(Parameterized.class). This seems like a very general mechanism
> to me. For example, I was able to write a test runnerlet to run JUnit
> 3.x AllTests in a few minutes. Would JUnit extenders find this
> annotation generally helpful?
> * The data comes from a static method instead of a static field. A
> method seemed more general than a field and is evaluated later, when the
> test is run instead of when the class is loaded. Totally static data can
> be simply implemented by a method which just returns that data.
> * Parameters are passed to a constructor instead of stuffed into
> fields. This seems more general as well as reducing the number of
> annotations by one. One limitation of the current implementation is that
> parameterized test classes can only have a single constructor.

I quite like this, Kent. It makes me happy to move my data-driven tests
back from Fit RowFixtures into JUnit.

Take care.
--
